title: An exam has 10 ‘true or false’ questions. What is the total number of ways in which these questions can be answered? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are total three possibilities for every question You may choose “True” as an answer.You may choose “False” as an answer.You can leave the question “unanswered”.Now since all the questions are independent to each other so total number of ways to answer 10 question can be found by multiplying the number of ways to answer each questions. And since number of ways to answer 1 question is 3. So number of ways to answer all the 10 question will be =3×3×3×3×3×3×3×3×3×3= 3^(10)=59049. Note: Most of people will support the answer that it will be 2×2×2×2×2×2×2×2×2×2=2^(10)=1024 but it is correct only when it is mentioned that you can not leave any question unanswered.

Well, to understand this solution you must know basics of PERMUTATIONS AND COMBINATIONS. Solution: You have 2 ways of answering a question ,i.e.,True or False. Hence for question, total possible ways of answering is 2 NOW, for answering 2 such questions your possible outcomes will be: true, truetrue, falsefalse, truefalse, falseHence you can see that for answering 2 questions you have 4 ways, i.e., 2^2 ways. Similarly, for 3 questions you have 2^3 ways; for 4 questions you have 2^4 ways and so on… Therefore for answering 10 True/False questions you have 2^10 ways.
